summary:
Mobile phones have evolved greatly since the first handheld call in 1973. From the heavy Motorola DynaTAC in 1983 to the sleek iPhone 6 Plus in 2014, they've become smaller, smarter, and more common.

In just over 20 years, mobile subscriptions grew to over seven billion worldwide. Smartphones, with advanced computing features, now dominate the market, with brands like Samsung and Apple leading the way.

These devices have changed how we communicate, offering calls, texts, internet access, and even games, making them an essential part of modern life.
title: Mobile phone
